Reviews.Title: “highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: fed_mil
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent. It is just a few meters away from the Gulhane tram stop and a short walk to the heart of Sultanahmet and all major sights (Topkapi, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia). We would definitely stay here again. As we were right next to the tram stop we even came and went to the airport by tram and metro (+/-45mins). The staff was helpful and recommended us some good restaurants. We had breakfast in the hotel everyday and the buffet is more than enough. Good selection of bread, cereals, cheese, coffee, juices and Turkish tea. Wifi signal was excellent and free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ben R
Reviews.Content: Make sure you have the correct address and details, as it's not easy to find for most taxi drivers (but once you find it, you shouldn't need a taxi as it's right in the middle of the old city) Excellent greeting, the people here can't do enough for you, pulling maps out and pointing out all the sites, smells and eateries of the city. Rooms are lovingly decorated, and all seem to be unique. We have a stunning view of the Hagia Sophia. Not many hotels can boast of one of the wonders of the Medieval world being 200m from its door. Breakfast is freshly made, and there's plenty of it, just don't expect a Las Vegas style buffet. Fruit, eggs, toast, olives, cereal. A good Mediterranean breakfast. All in all, an excellent hotel

Reviews.Title: “If only....”
Reviews.Author: Thai_Rain
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Modern Sultan Hotel for 2 nights for a weekend getaway. We've stayed in Sultanahmet many times with varying degrees of satisfaction. Price does not always equal quality and as this was just a quick trip we chose the Modern Sultan due to it's location and cheap room rate. The room was very small which in itself is not a problem but this is the first hotel I've stayed in ever where there was no television in the room or soap provided in the bathroom. There are a couple of small bottles of nondescript liquid but that's it. Our room was unfortunately situated at the top of the stairs and above the entrance to the hotel which allowed us to hear all the comings and goings inside and out. Unfortunately there was also no hot water on our first morning. Which I could have braced myself for had we been told, but we weren't until standing there waiting for it to heat up for several minutes clothed only in my towel I decided to ask reception to be told that it had stopped working the night before and should be fixed today - which indeed it was, fortunately! The breakfast was nice. Not a huge variety but typically Turkish with lots of vegetables, cheese etc... The staff are also very friendly (I believe it's family run). So on summing up...If only our room had hot water, a tv and soap. Basic things that make all the difference when you've got so much competition at your doorstep. Indeed there is a hostel right next door which is cheaper and has bigger private rooms - next time!

Reviews.Title: “Room 402; not a good stay due to the noise”
Reviews.Author: JerseyInShanghai
Reviews.Content: This should be a very nice hotel, but we had two major problems. Our room was almost but not quite finished with a renovation, so the paint smelled, the radiators needed fixing, the curtains were missing and the floors were barely covered by the rugs. They probably should not have given us the room due to the unfinished work. They staff were, however, very nice about trying to address these issues. The much bigger problem was the noise. Next door is a hostel which had a lounge on the top floor. Our room was one floor below, and faced this lounge. There were very loud parties every night until 1 am. You could hear the conversations distinctly and sing along to the loud music. I could hear the music in the hallway of the hotel down to the third floor, so if you stay here, I would ask for a low floor that does not face the back of the hotel. It's a shame because the other facets of the hotel were nice. Our family room had two rooms, one with a full size bed, another with two twin beds. The two bathrooms each had toilets, sinks and showers, although one had a very cramped shower. Soap and shampoo is provided. The room also had a chair, a dresser and a rack for towels. The room was a little cramped. It has a great view of the Ayasofya. The location is great since all of the Ayasofya, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Cistern and tons of shops and restaurants are within a five minute walk. Other items included were free wifi and breakfast. Breakfast was cereal, fruit, bread, cheese and meat, and toast with veggies and cheese on top.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: djdrs
Reviews.Content: Great location for visiting the major sites of the old town, very convenient to the tram line as well to get to modern Istanbul and to the trips on the Bosphorus. Walk-up, no elevator. The place just changed owners, we were there during the transition.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, quite and wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Ali D
Reviews.Content: First of all this hotel is in an excellent location in Sultanahmet area, close to all the main attractions yet tucked away in a quite alley that provides it with a relaxing and quite atmosphere. However, you will probably find many other hotels with similar location advantages in Sultanahmet. The difference for me was the atmosphere inside the hotel itself. As some reviewers have mentioned, you get the feeling you are very welcome and at home. We stayed in a double room which just had a bed with no other furniture, but the bed was very comfortable and the decor was very nice. The owner and staff are friendly and always helpful. They always gave us tips where to go or what to eat, and even lent us utensils to cut the fruit we had bought. The bathroom was tiny and the fan a bit loud, but we didn't mind. We have only two negatives to say about the place. 1) Rooms are not sound proof at all. You can hear footsteps outside and when someone is walking up/down the stairs, if you stay in the first level you can even hear the chatter from the reception which can be a bit annoying. 2) They had some maintance work done in the hotel during our stay, we didn't' hear any noise but one day I stepped out and a tool fell from the construction staff just outside the entrance. It wasn't a close to hitting me but it could well have did. Overall, I highly recommend Modern Sultan hotel! We even returned here for the last leg of our trip in Turkey to spend few more days because we had such a nice time.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of my stay!”
Reviews.Author: XXXTravelGuyXxX
Reviews.Content: I am still in the middle of my stay and I felt compelled to write. I love this place! Why? well, the owners are Rhonda and Jeannie and when I checked in, they were so relaxed and welcoming, it felt like I was checking into a friends house. I needed to change currency that the airport changers wouldn't accept. Rhonda not only told me where to go, but she gave me tips on what area i would get the best rates and she informed me of the common scams. Even the bell boy pulled out a card and gave it to me in case I got confused as to where my hotel was. Weird, huh! NO, I LOVED IT! I could be a bit of a Divo (male Diva) and I think this place is great. i like the decor. It's VERY clean. My room was small but I didn't FEEL cramped. The view of The Blue Mosque from my room should be on a postcard. You CANNOT get a better view! You literally walk out of the hotel (and I think it's more of a boutique guesthouse) and BAMB! Within 30 seconds you are right in the midst of hustle and bustle! I hope the rest of my stay is this good!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable hotel very close to key tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: travelnovelist
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel in the Sultanahmet area, in a relatively quiet side street about five minutes' walk from the Hagia Sofia, the Blue Mosque, the Basilica Cistern, etc. Also very close to restaurants, bars, tram stops, etc. The hotel is run by two Canadian friends -- Jeannie and Rhonda. Jeannie's little girl is also there to charm everyone. J. and R. are absolutely friendly and helpful and treat the guests as if they were family. They also have useful suggestions for what to do and see. (For example, they suggested sailing on the Bosphorus and hiking around Yoros Castle and the enchanting island of Heybeliada). The rooms are small but clean and tastefully decorated, though they have a thing for beads. The bed was very comfortable. Breakfast is basic (boiled eggs, toast, fruit, tea/coffee), but filling. Found it very relaxing, and even got to know some of the other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice to stay in”
Reviews.Author: TerenceHK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to the main attractions in Istanbul, namely, the Topkapi Palace, Saint Sophie Cathedral and the Blue Mosque. You only need a 5 -minute walk to reach all these attraction. Walking to the piers near Galata Bridge and the Grand Bazaar will only takes 15 minutes. Two tram stations are close to the hotel. There are stores nearby and it only takes you 5 minute to walk to a supermarket. Its location is perfect. The room we stayed in has good design. It is very clean and well maintained. The staff are very friendly and gave us a lot of information about the area. She advised us to visit the special event during the Ramadan held at the square between the Cathedral and the Blue Mosque, which is a must not only for the tourist but also for locals. Our room also has a good view of the Cathedral. We had a very good stay here.

Reviews.Title: “budget with class in great central location”
Reviews.Author: RoryDubai
Reviews.Content: The two partners who run this hotel are from Alberta in Canada. Jeannie and Rhonda were helpful and friendly at all times. They went out of their way to add little touches to make the atmosphere welcoming and relaxing. I liked the soft music in the breakfast room, the incense and candles. The location is as good as it gets for Sultanahmed and many of the main sites of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location, and excellent hospitality”
Reviews.Author: sanjeev342
Reviews.Content: We had a family of 15 all stay at this hotel in June, and our family ranged from youngsters to seniors. Every single one of us will attest to the high quality of service and level of comfort at Modern Sultan Hotel. Rhonda and Jeanie were extremely helpful and very hospitable. They answered all our questions (we had a lot of questions) and went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed the trip. The location was also excellent; the street view of the Hagia Sophia is breathtaking. Also, everything from the restaurants to the historical sights were within walking distance, making the hotel a perfect base for getting around in Istanbul. Overall, the hotel was an incredible experience. The two strongest reasons for this were first the location, and second, most importantly, the undeniable excellence in hospitality and service we received from the owners. If you're staying in Istanbul, you MUST stay at the Modern Sultan Hotel. -The Pillutla Family

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful and welcoming place”
Reviews.Author: karenbamonte
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Modern Sultan Hotel for 5 nights in June 2011 and cannot rave about it enough. The two Canadian women who own it were incredibly well informed and very helpful during our entire stay. Their suggestions were always on target. Our room was beautifully decorated, clean, spacious, well equipped and had a wonderful view. The breakfast was generous and delicious. This is a small boutique style hotel that is well worth the very reasonable price. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, watch out the minaret”
Reviews.Author: komalo
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife, we stayed at this hotel during our short trip to Istambul in March 2011. The hotel is pretty small (6 or 8 rooms), located in the center of the Old Town. We had direct view to Hagia Sophia - room 402, which is a little bit more expensive than others. We paid 68 Euro, instead of 48 Euro per room (without the view) - breakfast included. Advantages: 1. Great location 2. Clean Disadvantages: - small minaret is right by the window - so you need earplug not to be waken up early The hotel is owned by 2 Canadian ladies - very nice and very helpful. Generally - we are satisfied staying at this hotel. The cheapest way to get from the airport to the hotel is to take metro to Zeytinburnu station, then change to tram which goes to KabataÅŸ - get off at 16th stop Sultanahmet. You need to buy jeton for each ride which cost 1.75 TL (3.5 TL all together). When you get off - it's just 5 minute walk to get to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lovely little hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: oxfordlawyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Modern Sultan Hotel with our five year old son for four nights in February 2011. The hotel is great value for money, clean and perfectly located - very close to the Blue Mosque and tram stops for further afield. The staff and owner and all very helpful and friendly and we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great establishment!”
Reviews.Author: Tylerellen
Reviews.Content: The owner of the Modern Sultan's name is Jeannie and she is a saint! She was one of the most accommodating and helpful people we came across during our trip in Istanbul. The Modern Sultan is a clean, safe and trustworthy establishment. The location simply cannot be beat if your there for sightseeing! I will definitely make a point to stay here on my next visit to Istanbul. Thanks for everything!

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: nenaqu
Reviews.Content: just returned from a fabulous trip to istanbul and turkey. part of my trip included a stay with this hotel. it was exactly the type of hotel i love to stay at. it had a fantastic location: just minutes away from the tram (easy to get to and from airport). you can walk to all the major sites in sultanahmet and because of the close proximity to the tram you can go anywhere in instanbul. the hotel itself is quiet, clean, well maintained and a fantasitic deal in terms of pricing. the people there helpful and generous. if you need and desire a place to sleep comfortablely and have a nice hot shower at the end of the day, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: cmjonesnyc
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, close to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and public transportation. Clean, comfortable, warm, friendly service. Staying with Rhonda and Jeannie was like staying with friends. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and would stay there again. We had a fantastic time!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - no luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hansen_35
Reviews.Content: The staff is very frienly and helpful and very serviceminded. They want you to have a nice vacation in Istanbul. The location of the hotel is very great - very close to all the sights. The hotel is very Turkish arranged. The breakfast is simpel and the coffee very bad. No juice or water is served. The rooms are very small and very moisted and cold. We have no new clean towels within a 5 days period. The bathroom has a very noisy ventilator (turned when light in the bathroom was turned on). The bathroom has a very bad smell even though it was clean. The hot water was not stable when many people went to the bath at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: ebest_10
Reviews.Content: We were met at the airport in Istanbul and driven directly to theModern Sultan Hotel in Istanbul. The owners of the hotel were extremely gracious and made our stay very rewarding. They were very helpful with advice on events and places to go which made our stay in Istanbul, very informative and entertaining. The rooms were lovely and the location was incredible. The staff was friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to this exciting city. I loved the Turkish breakfasts!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Boston_Desi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our honeymoon in Turkey and this was the last hotel we stayed in. The owners, Rhonda and Jeannie are extremely helpful and their staff are amongst the nicest people we met on our trip. We booked a double room and Jeannie upgraded us to a suite part way through. The rooms are bright, clean and airy and have wonderful natural light. The double was a bit snug for us - we were there for 4 days and with the mid-week upgrade, it didn't make sense to unpack, so maneuvering around the both of our 24 inch suitcases was a bit challenging. The suite was excellent - lots of space, a daybed and a lovely view of the Hagia Sophia from the balcony. Bathrooms are modern, clean and have plenty of hot water. The hotel is a 2 minute walk to the Hagia Sophia and is right next to the tramline.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dhart
Reviews.Content: I was a single gal traveling alone in Istanbul and this hotel could not have been any more wonderful. It's centrally located, walking distance to almost everything, and the tram (Gulhane stop) is only one block down the road. It's in a quiet area of the Old City so besides the Blue Mosque's morning Call to Prayer I didn't hear a thing. There was some great food options just a few blocks away and it was only a 5-10 min walk to the Blue Mosque, Topkaki Palace, Haghia Sophia, and the Grand Bazaar. Two Canadian women run the hotel and they are lovely women who are very accommodating and knowledgeable about the city. They even helped me ship some items home! I stayed in a small single room that met all my needs, WiFi worked throughout the hotel and the Turkish breakfast was a great way to start the day. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again - thank you for the lovely stay!

Reviews.Title: “It's like staying in a cosy home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: KPKhoo
Reviews.Content: Had a truly lovely stay at the hotel with my family. The airport pickup was there waiting when we arrived. Our room was ready for us and Ahmed helped lug our luggage up. Thanks, Ahmed. Room was big enough for 4 of us along with our luggage. Breakfast was good and location superb. We were able to find our way around pretty quickly. Really cosy place to stay, thanks to the 2 ladies who run the place. Too bad we didn't get a group photo, girls...would have loved having a photo of sweet Leila. Would definitely stay here again as it's value for money. The staff's friendliness is a plus point.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: male_020
Reviews.Content: Had a excellent stay at this hotel last week. Hotel is very centrally located, in the center of Istanbul in a quiet street; walking distance from all the major sites of Istanbul. Close to the tram, which will bring you to other neighborhoods, airport included. Rooms are tiny, but clean. No TV, but excellent wireless internet access. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Good breakfast in the morning, conclusive: real value for money!

Reviews.Title: “no guranteed booking”
Reviews.Author: memoEgypt
Reviews.Content: if you want to be sure with your booking dont book in this hotel...there are many hotels in the same area with good prices.. otherwise u may surprised like me when u arrive that there is no bed 4u..!! later i found out that i wasnt the only case...there was another egyptian guy and irish girl have the same problem.. then they drive you to their friends hostel...and u have no other choice when u dont know where to sleep while u just arrived.. if u protest they will tell u that u make a problem...sure u make a problem for them so let them relax.. very very bad experience...and dont fooled by good reviews..

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in this amazing city !!”
Reviews.Author: tas234
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel in the last 4 months, this in itself should speak for my experience. Great staff who are willing to help with any needs, the rooms are kept very clean and each has it own unique and classic charm. This hotel is the perfect location blue mosque, topkapi palace, grand bazaar, egyptian spice bazaar and more are all within a short walk of the hotel. The staff here were great at helping me organize my sight seeing during both stays and organized an excursion for me to Effisis and Pummakale which was amazing. I would definately recommend this hotel to all me friends and family and I cannot wait to visit again!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: JugyH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the modern Sultan Hotel in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul for 2 weeks last October. It is in the perfect spot...walking distance to all the main sites (Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Eqyptian Spice Bazaar). The staff are friendly and very knowlegeable of the area. The staff can speak english so we had no translation issues. The hotel itself is beautiful. Small and cozy with antique furniture and rugs. Makes you almost not want to venture outside. The staff hooked us up with a city tour, an overnight stay on Heybeliada (one of the Prince Islands) and an excursion down south. It was a holiday to remember!!

HotelInfo.Name: Modern Sultan Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Zeynep Sultan Camii Sk#19 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul, Turkey
